quote: I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Outside of a dog, a book is a man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Until one has loved an animal a part of one's soul remains unawakened.
author: Anatole France

quote: Never wear anything that panics the cat.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: If having a soul means being able to feel love and loyalty and gratitude, then animals are better off than a lot of humans.
author: James Herriot

quote: He who is cruel to animals becomes hard also in his dealings with men. We can judge the heart of a man by his treatment of animals.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Animals are such agreeable friends - they ask no questions; they pass no criticisms.
author: George Eliot

quote: A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than you love yourself.
author: Josh Billings

quote: The trouble with a kitten is that eventually it becomes a cat.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: There are two means of refuge from the miseries of life: music and cats.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Money can buy you a fine dog, but only love can make him wag his tail.
author: Kinky Friedman

quote: The average dog is a nicer person than the average person.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: No matter how much cats fight, there always seem to be plenty of kittens.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Dogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.
author: Roger Caras

quote: I poured spot remover on my dog. Now he's gone.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Scratch a dog and you'll find a permanent job.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: An animal's eyes have the power to speak a great language.
author: Martin Buber

quote: My mother and dad were big animal lovers, too. I just don't know how I would have lived without animals around me. I'm fascinated by them - both domestic pets and the wild community. They just are the most interesting things in the world to me, and it's made such a difference in my lifetime.
author: Betty White

quote: Pets are humanizing. They remind us we have an obligation and responsibility to preserve and nurture and care for all life.
author: James Cromwell

quote: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight - it's the size of the fight in the dog.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: You cannot share your life with a dog, as I had done in Bournemouth, or a cat, and not know perfectly well that animals have personalities and minds and feelings.
author: Jane Goodall

quote: The better I get to know men, the more I find myself loving dogs.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: There is no psychiatrist in the world like a puppy licking your face.
author: Bernard Williams

quote: My little dog - a heartbeat at my feet.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: I wonder if other dogs think poodles are members of a weird religious cult.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Dogs are better than human beings because they know but do not tell.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Dogs are my favorite people.
author: Richard Dean Anderson

quote: I believe cats to be spirits come to earth. A cat, I am sure, could walk on a cloud without coming through.
author: Jules Verne

quote: The smallest feline is a masterpiece.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: It is much easier to show compassion to animals. They are never wicked.
author: Haile Selassie

quote: The clever cat eats cheese and breathes down rat holes with baited breath.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: I worked in a pet store and people would ask how big I would get.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: If a dog will not come to you after having looked you in the face, you should go home and examine your conscience.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: I love women, but I feel like you can't trust some of them. Some of them are liars, you know? Like I was in the park and I met this girl, she was cute and she had a dog. And I went up to her, we started talking. She told me her dog's name. Then I said, 'Does he bite?' She said, 'No.' And I said, 'Oh yeah? Then how does he eat?' Liar.
author: Demetri Martin

quote: Cats have it all - admiration, an endless sleep, and company only when they want it.
author: Rod McKuen

quote: Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: Dogs got personality. Personality goes a long way.
author: Quentin Tarantino

quote: A real Christian is a person who can give his pet parrot to the town gossip.
author: Billy Graham

quote: To his dog, every man is Napoleon; hence the constant popularity of dogs.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Don't accept your dog's admiration as conclusive evidence that you are wonderful.
author: Ann Landers

quote: The dog is the god of frolic.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Animals are sentient, intelligent, perceptive, funny and entertaining. We owe them a duty of care as we do to children.
author: Michael Morpurgo

quote: Animals are reliable, many full of love, true in their affections, predictable in their actions, grateful and loyal. Difficult standards for people to live up to.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

quote: Like all pure creatures, cats are practical.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Time spent with cats is never wasted.
author: Unknown

quote: Pets have more love and compassion in them than most humans.
author: Robert Wagner

quote: Cats have a scam going - you buy the food, they eat the food, they go away; that's the deal.
author: Eddie Izzard

quote: Cats seem to go on the principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: It's difficult to understand why people don't realize that pets are gifts to mankind.
author: Linda Blair

quote: Dogs laugh, but they laugh with their tails.
author: Max Eastman

quote: I love cats because I enjoy my home; and little by little, they become its visible soul.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Do not make the mistake of treating your dogs like humans or they will treat you like dogs.
author: Martha Scott

quote: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a function.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: Before you get a dog, you can't quite imagine what living with one might be like; afterward, you can't imagine living any other way.
author: Caroline Knapp

quote: If you are a dog and your owner suggests that you wear a sweater suggest that he wear a tail.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: I used to love dogs until I discovered cats.
author: Nafisa Joseph

quote: Just watching my cats can make me happy.
author: Paula Cole

quote: A dog teaches a boy fidelity, perseverance, and to turn around three times before lying down.
author: Robert Benchley
